examples.correct: adenina se conecta à timina

examples.wrong: Personagens não se limitam à personagens principais
examples.correct: Personagens não se limitam a personagens principais
examples.context: Incorrect use of crase before plural noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Mixing English words or incorrect syntactic structures in Portuguese sentences, disrupting comprehension and natural flow.

examples.correct: eles são o combustível...
examples.context: English pronoun used in Portuguese sentence.

examples.correct: A eletronegatividade... em um período...

top_error_patterns.description: Statements that misrepresent cultural or educational practices in Brazil, leading to misleading or incorrect information for the target audience.

examples.wrong: Embora textos de ficção possam ser interessantes e envolventes, eles são principalmente criados para entretenimento e não para fins educacionais.
examples.correct: Embora textos de ficção sejam geralmente criados para entretenimento, eles também podem ser usados para fins educacionais, como estimular a criatividade, promover a empatia ou ilustrar conceitos em sala de aula.
examples.context: Misrepresentation of the educational use of fiction in Brazilian schools.

examples.wrong: A participação cívica é uma atividade que só é realizada em dias de feriado nacional.
examples.correct: A participação cívica é uma atividade que pode ser realizada em qualquer dia, não apenas em feriados nacionais.
examples.context: Incorrectly limiting civic participation to national holidays, ignoring its ongoing nature in Brazilian society.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of imperial units (feet) instead of metric units (meter), which are standard in Brazil, causing confusion and reducing clarity.

examples.wrong: Mantenha aquecedores a pelo menos três pés de distância de objetos inflamáveis.
examples.correct: Mantenha aquecedores a pelo menos um metro de distância de objetos inflamáveis.
examples.context: Distance measurements in safety instructions use non-standard units for the Brazilian audience.

top_error_patterns.description: Failure to translate important English terms into their standard Portuguese equivalents, reducing comprehension and professionalism.

examples.correct: sistema de freios e contrapesos
examples.context: Political science terminology left untranslated, hindering understanding in educational content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inappropriate Use of Emojis in Formal Educational Content
top_error_patterns.description: Emojis are frequently used in educational texts, but they are considered informal and unprofessional in Brazilian Portuguese academic contexts. Their removal improves tone and cultural fit.

examples.wrong: Bem-vindos ao fascinante mundo do Egito Antigo! ✨
examples.correct: Bem-vindos ao fascinante mundo do Egito Antigo!

examples.wrong: Essas técnicas irão ajudá-lo a analisar textos com confiança e eficiência. 📚
examples.correct: Essas técnicas irão ajudá-lo a analisar textos com confiança e eficiência.

examples.wrong: Vamos explorar juntos a história, os desafios e as tecnologias que moldaram a exploração espacial, conectando esses conceitos aos princípios científicos do movimento orbital. 🚀
examples.correct: Vamos explorar juntos a história, os desafios e as tecnologias que moldaram a exploração espacial, conectando esses conceitos aos princípios científicos do movimento orbital.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or expressions that are literal translations, anglicisms, or regionally inappropriate, resulting in unnatural or imprecise language for Brazilian Portuguese educational content.

examples.wrong: A membrana celular é bastante selectiva na sua permissividade.
examples.correct: A membrana celular é bastante seletiva na sua permissividade.
examples.context: European Portuguese spelling instead of Brazilian Portuguese.

examples.correct: locais de votação
examples.context: Literal translation of 'polling stations' instead of the standard term.

examples.correct: defesa de questões importantes
examples.context: False friend; 'advocacia' refers to the legal profession.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of English terms or non-standard translations instead of locally accepted Brazilian Portuguese terminology, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.correct: Ciberbullying
retornos
examples.context: Instructions for peer review or feedback

examples.correct: método Cornell

top_error_patterns.description: Terms are used that do not align with Brazilian Portuguese conventions, such as direct translations, anglicisms, or less formal words, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.correct: semiconservativa

examples.wrong: Chatbots oferecem suporte rápido ao cliente.
examples.correct: Assistentes virtuais oferecem suporte rápido ao cliente.
prévia do texto

top_error_patterns.description: Phrases are constructed in ways that are grammatically correct but sound unnatural or less idiomatic in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting readability and engagement.

examples.correct: misturar ao ambiente
Você ainda não é adulto.

examples.wrong: Métodos incluem o uso de ferramentas...
examples.correct: As técnicas incluem o uso de ferramentas...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect use of definite articles and prepositions
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent omission or misuse of definite articles ('o', 'a', 'os', 'as') and prepositions (including crase) in noun phrases and verb constructions, leading to grammatical inaccuracies and reduced clarity.

examples.wrong: A localização do Egito conectava-o a outras regiões, promovendo comércio e intercâmbio cultural.
examples.correct: A localização do Egito conectava-o a outras regiões, promovendo o comércio e o intercâmbio cultural.
examples.context: Omission of articles before nouns in educational explanations.

examples.wrong: Trabalhem juntos para achar opções que atendam todos.
examples.correct: Trabalhem juntos para achar opções que atendam a todos.
examples.context: Missing preposition required by the verb 'atender'.

examples.wrong: Este comportamento é um exemplo de bondade diária que pode ser facilmente incorporado na rotina diária de alguém.
examples.correct: Este comportamento é um exemplo de bondade diária que pode ser facilmente incorporado à rotina diária de alguém.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of phrases or constructions that are grammatically correct but not idiomatic or clear in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting the naturalness and comprehension of educational material.

examples.wrong: Pressione forte e rápido, 100-120 compressões por minuto.
examples.correct: Pressione com força e rapidez, 100-120 compressões por minuto.

examples.wrong: Plano de evacuação: Crie e pratique um plano de fuga familiar com duas saídas de cada cômodo.
examples.correct: Plano de evacuação: Crie e pratique um plano de fuga para a família com duas saídas de cada cômodo.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or expressions that are grammatically correct but not idiomatic or precise in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Ratos-canguru que sobrevivem sem beber água...
examples.correct: Ratos-canguru que sobrevivem sem ingerir água...
habilidades sociais sólidas
examples.context: Describing social skills in group work

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in matching gender and number between nouns, adjectives, and verbs, which can confuse learners and reduce the professionalism of the content.

examples.wrong: Strings podem ser armazenados como números.
examples.correct: Strings podem ser armazenadas como números.
examples.context: Incorrect gender agreement with the noun 'strings'.

examples.correct: compartilhar tais dados pessoais
examples.context: Mismatch in number and gender in noun phrase.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect sentence type for Yes/No questions
top_error_patterns.description: Statements are used instead of questions in Yes/No quiz items, missing the question mark and proper interrogative structure.

examples.wrong: O numerador pode ser maior que o denominador em uma fração.
examples.correct: O numerador pode ser maior que o denominador em uma fração?
examples.context: Yes/No question context in math quizzes

examples.wrong: Toda fração é maior que um todo.
examples.correct: Toda fração é maior que um todo?
examples.context: Yes/No question context in math quizzes

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Grammatical agreement and article usage errors
top_error_patterns.description: Omission or incorrect use of definite articles, verb conjugation mismatches, and number agreement errors that affect sentence correctness.

examples.wrong: Desperdício de materiais e energia não tem impacto...
examples.correct: O desperdício de materiais e energia não tem impacto...
Exemplos incluem mastros de bandeiras...

examples.wrong: Por exemplo, enquanto mercados emergentes como China e Índia prosperam...
examples.correct: Por exemplo, enquanto mercados emergentes como a China e a Índia prosperam...
examples.context: Missing definite articles before country names

top_error_patterns.description: Spelling mistakes and use of European Portuguese variants instead of Brazilian Portuguese, which can distract learners and reduce localization quality.

examples.correct: protótipos
examples.context: Missing accent in a scientific term.

examples.correct: Porcentagens
examples.context: European Portuguese variant instead of Brazilian Portuguese.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Cultural References Not Adapted for Brazilian Context
top_error_patterns.description: Examples, anecdotes, or references that are US-centric or globally generic, rather than locally relevant, reducing relatability and engagement for Brazilian students.

examples.wrong: Exemplos incluem os Estados Unidos importando eletrônicos da China e exportando produtos agrícolas como trigo e milho...
examples.correct: Exemplos incluem o Brasil importando eletrônicos da China e exportando produtos agrícolas como soja e café...

examples.wrong: Michael Jordan, considerado um dos maiores jogadores de basquete de todos os tempos...
examples.correct: Use a Brazilian sports figure or provide more context.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of general or imprecise terms instead of standard scientific or technical vocabulary, affecting accuracy and comprehension.

examples.correct: segmento de reta
estado da matéria

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect or Unnatural Imperative and Instructional Style
top_error_patterns.description: Use of impersonal or singular imperative forms in instructions where plural or direct forms are more natural and engaging for Brazilian learners.

examples.wrong: Evitar escrever em CAIXA ALTA, que pode parecer gritar.
examples.correct: Evite escrever em CAIXA ALTA, pois isso pode ser interpretado como grito.
Trabalhem juntos para encontrar soluções.

top_error_patterns.description: References to foreign currency or formats that do not match Brazilian standards, reducing cultural fit and comprehension.

examples.wrong: Uma moeda de 25 centavos vale 1/4 de um dólar.
examples.correct: Uma moeda de 25 centavos vale 1/4 de um real.

top_error_patterns.description: The abbreviation 'Ex.:' is repeatedly used instead of the standard 'Exemplo:' in Brazilian Portuguese educational materials, affecting clarity and professionalism.

examples.correct: Exemplo: pão, arroz, frutas.
Exemplo: arroz, macarrão
Exemplo: espinafre, maçãs

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect or missing punctuation and capitalization
top_error_patterns.description: Minor errors such as missing commas, unnecessary exclamation marks, incorrect capitalization at sentence start, or improper use of hyphens.

examples.wrong: O número `5` na equação `x + 5 = 10` é de fato uma constante...
examples.correct: O número `5` na equação `x + 5 = 10` é, de fato, uma constante...
raios X
examples.context: Compound noun spelling in science content

examples.wrong: a Torá é o texto sagrado...
examples.correct: A Torá é o texto sagrado...
examples.context: Capitalization at start of bullet point

top_error_patterns.description: Use of adjectives instead of adverbs in formal educational contexts, reducing grammatical precision.

examples.wrong: crescem mais rápido do que em áreas sombreadas
examples.correct: crescem mais rapidamente do que em áreas sombreadas
examples.context: Describing growth rates in science content

examples.correct: crescem mais rapidamente foi confirmada...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Non-Localized Formatting of Numbers and Dates
top_error_patterns.description: Formatting conventions for numbers and date ranges follow English standards rather than Brazilian Portuguese, which can cause confusion or reduce cultural fit.

examples.correct: século V a IV a.C.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of half-width periods ('.'), double periods, or unnecessary Western punctuation at the end of Japanese sentences, which disrupts readability and violates Japanese orthographic conventions.

examples.wrong: ナイル川はエジプトの生涯にわたる経済発展の重要な要因でした.
examples.correct: ナイル川はエジプトの長きにわたる経済発展の重要な要因でした。
examples.context: Sentence ends with half-width period instead of Japanese full stop.

examples.wrong: 感情は私たちが自然に経験するものです。異なる人々は異なる感情を持つことがありますが、感情自体は全員が経験するものではありません。...
examples.correct: 感情は私たちが自然に経験するものです。異なる人々は異なる感情を持つことがありますが、感情自体は全員が経験するものです。

examples.wrong: 儿童は自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。.
examples.correct: 子どもは自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。
examples.context: Half-width period after Japanese full stop.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Lexical errors and unnatural word choices
top_error_patterns.description: Use of non-standard, incorrect, or unnatural words and phrases that are not appropriate in Japanese, leading to confusion or misinterpretation.

examples.wrong: 冷却帯の温度は非常に高いため、生物多様性が豊かです。
examples.correct: 極地気候帯の温度は非常に低いため、生物多様性は限られています。

examples.wrong: 冷革な対話が続きます。
examples.correct: 冷静な対話が続きます。
examples.context: Non-existent word '冷革' instead of '冷静'.

examples.wrong: 物語の中心的なアイデアは物語の説得力としかりみです。
examples.correct: 物語の中心的なアイデアは物語の説得力と魅力です。
examples.context: Typographical error 'しかりみ' instead of '魅力'.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of incorrect grammatical structures, negative forms, or logical contradictions that obscure meaning and reduce clarity.

examples.wrong: 三角形には頂点が3つすべてではありません。
examples.correct: 三角形には必ず3つの頂点があります。
examples.context: Logical contradiction and incorrect negative construction.

examples.wrong: オンラインで共有される情報は必ずしも重要です。.
examples.correct: オンラインで共有される情報は必ずしも重要ではありません。

examples.wrong: 族は同じ族に属する元素の数の電子が同じであることによって決まります。.
examples.correct: 族は同じ族に属する元素の外殻電子の数が同じであることによって決まります。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Use of non-Japanese or corrupted characters
top_error_patterns.description: Presence of Chinese terms, corrupted text, or incomplete words due to encoding errors, which severely impact comprehension and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 儿童は自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。.
examples.correct: 子どもは自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。
examples.context: Chinese term '儿童' instead of Japanese '子ども'.

examples.wrong: 強力なパスワードは短く簡����antoいすることが推奨されます。.
examples.correct: 強力なパスワードは短く簡単にすることが推奨されます。

examples.wrong: アメリカの選挙は公開され、市民が自由に参加することができる民主的なプロセスです。この誤解を解消するために、選挙はどのような民主主義の基礎であるかを考えてみてくだ�。
examples.correct: アメリカの選挙は公開され、市民が自由に参加することができる民主的なプロセスです。この誤解を解消するために、選挙はどのような民主主義の基礎であるかを考えてみてください。
examples.context: Incomplete word due to encoding error.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of incorrect scientific terms or factual errors that misrepresent key concepts, affecting educational accuracy and learner trust.

examples.wrong: 原子構成は元素の酸素電子数によって決定されます。.
examples.correct: 原子構成は元素の原子番号によって決定されます。
examples.context: Non-standard term '酸素電子数' instead of '原子番号'.

examples.wrong: 核電荷が周期によって減少する.
examples.correct: 核電荷は周期によって増加する。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of terms that misrepresent key concepts, leading to factual inaccuracies and confusion for learners.

examples.wrong: ノンフィクション書は、歴史上の人物の生活についての創作物です。
examples.correct: ノンフィクション書は、歴史上の人物の生活についての創作物ではありません。
examples.context: Definition of non-fiction misrepresented, causing misunderstanding of genre distinctions.

top_error_patterns.description: Selection of words that are culturally inappropriate or unnatural in educational contexts, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 記憶の力を最大限に活用する秘謀です。
examples.correct: 記憶の力を最大限に活用する方法です。
examples.context: Use of '秘謀' (secret plot) instead of '方法' (method) in instructional content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with both Japanese full stop (。) and half-width period (.)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences frequently end with a Japanese full stop (。) immediately followed by a half-width period (.), resulting in double punctuation. This is not standard in Japanese writing and affects professionalism and readability.

examples.wrong: 古代エジプトではファラオの権力が絶えず変わり、各ファラオは建築に大きな貢納を求めませんでした.
examples.correct: 古代エジプトではファラオの権力が絶えず変わり、各ファラオは建築に大きな貢納を求めませんでした。

examples.wrong: 感情は私たちの経験に影響を与える。.
examples.correct: 感情は私たちの経験に影響を与える。

examples.wrong: 科学的手法は主に芸術的なスキルの発展を目指すために使われます。.
examples.correct: 科学的手法は主に芸術的なスキルの発展を目指すために使われます。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with half-width period (.) instead of full-width Japanese period (。)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with a half-width period (.) rather than the standard Japanese full-width period (。), which is incorrect in Japanese writing and affects the naturalness and correctness of the text.

examples.wrong: 感情知能を持つ人は、自分の感情や他人の感情のニュアンスをより深く理解することができる.
examples.correct: 感情知能を持つ人は、自分の感情や他人の感情のニュアンスをより深く理解することができる。

examples.wrong: 困難な課題を避けることが成長にとって最も有益である.
examples.correct: 困難な課題を避けることが成長にとって最も有益である。

examples.wrong: イオン推進システムは化学ロケットよりも速い速度で宇宙に到達できます.
examples.correct: イオン推進システムは化学ロケットよりも速い速度で宇宙に到達できます。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of kanji or terms that are incorrect or unnatural in Japanese, often due to direct translation or confusion with similar Chinese characters.

examples.wrong: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁荣することが一般的です。.
examples.correct: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁栄することが一般的です。
examples.context: Incorrect kanji '繁荣' used instead of '繁栄'; also contains mixed punctuation.

examples.wrong: グローバル貿易は経済成長を消減させることがあります。
examples.correct: グローバル貿易は経済成長を減少させることがあります。
examples.context: Non-standard term '消減' used instead of the natural '減少'.

top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with both Japanese and Western periods, or contain unnecessary punctuation, which disrupts readability and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁荣することが一般的です。.
examples.correct: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁栄することが一般的です。
examples.context: Ends with both Japanese full stop and English period.

examples.wrong: その通りです。感情は私たちの経験、たとえそれが短期間であっても長期間もあります。喜びや悲しみ、怒りなど、感情は私たちの行動や考え方に影響を与え、人間関係において重要な役割を果たします。.
examples.correct: その通りです。感情は私たちの経験、たとえそれが短期間であっても長期間であってもあります。喜びや悲しみ、怒りなど、感情は私たちの行動や考え方に影響を与え、人間関係において重要な役割を果たします。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of verb forms that are grammatically incorrect or unnatural in Japanese, affecting clarity and flow.

examples.wrong: イデーションは困難を探しているプロセスです。
examples.correct: イデーションは困難を探すプロセスです。
examples.context: Continuous verb form '探している' used instead of the more appropriate '探す'.

examples.wrong: 記憶術は、覚えやすいものや既知のものに情報を関連付けることで記憶を助けるツールです。
examples.correct: 記憶術は、覚えやすいものや既知のものに情報を関連付けて記憶を助ける方法です。
examples.context: Verb phrase and noun choice ('ツール' vs '方法') are unnatural for educational context.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnatural lexical choices or direct loan translations
top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that are direct translations from English or otherwise unnatural in Japanese, reducing clarity and localization fit.

examples.wrong: これは、相互作用がフィールドが異なる可能性があるためです。
examples.correct: これは、相互作用する相手の背景が異なる可能性があるためです。
examples.context: Direct loan 'フィールド' used instead of natural '背景'.

examples.wrong: デジタルエチケットは、私がオンラインで見せる外見が全ての世界で受け取られるという考えに基づいていません。
examples.correct: デジタルエチケットは、私がオンラインで見せる外見が全ての世界で受け入れられるという考えに基づいていません。
examples.context: Incorrect verb '受け取られる' used instead of '受け入れられる'.

top_error_patterns.description: Sentences contain awkward phrasing or incorrect particle usage, making them difficult to understand or less idiomatic.

examples.wrong: この私たちの食事には、炭水化物をサラダやご飯に、タンパク質を鶏肉や豆腐に、脂質をオリーブオイルやナッツにとることで摂取する食材が含まれています。
examples.correct: 私たちの食事には、サラダやご飯から炭水化物、鶏肉や豆腐からタンパク質、オリーブオイルやナッツから脂質を摂取する食材が含まれています。
examples.context: Unnatural phrasing and incorrect particle usage for nutrient sources.

examples.wrong: 陰影の技法には、光源の位置が関係ない。
examples.correct: 陰影の技法には、光源の位置が関係ありません。
examples.context: Plain negative form used instead of polite form, affecting tone and register.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of backticks and asterisks for math expressions is not standard in Japanese educational content. Proper formatting uses plain numbers/variables and the multiplication sign (×).

examples.wrong:
シャツ一枚の値段が`20`円で、3枚購入すると合計費用は:
- `x = 20`（シャツ1枚の値段）  
- 合計 = `3 * x = 3 * 20 = 60`円
examples.correct:
シャツ一枚の値段が20円で、3枚購入すると合計費用は:
- x = 20（シャツ1枚の値段）
- 合計 = 3 × x = 3 × 20 = 60円

top_error_patterns.description: Direct translations about copyright (e.g., gratitude and payment for permission) are unnatural and may mislead learners. Standard Japanese uses '許可を得るべきです' for clarity.

examples.wrong: オリジナルの作品の著作者に感謝と支払いの形で承認を得るべきです。
examples.correct: オリジナルの作品の著作者から許可を得るべきです。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Misleading or unclear terminology for genre definitions
top_error_patterns.description: Genre definitions (e.g., non-fiction) use ambiguous or informal phrasing. Polite, clear forms are preferred for educational clarity.

examples.wrong: ノンフィクションは完全に架空の世界ではない。
examples.correct: ノンフィクションは完全に架空の世界ではありません。

top_error_patterns.description: Directly translated scientific phrases (e.g., '証拠を提供します') are less natural in Japanese. Use '示しています' for clearer, culturally appropriate explanations.

examples.wrong: これらの記憶テクニックは脳の構造が認知機能をサポートする証拠を提供します。
examples.correct: これらの記憶テクニックは脳の構造が認知機能を支えることを示しています。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of US-style phone numbers is inappropriate for Japanese learners. Japanese phone number formats should be used for cultural relevance.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with two consecutive full-width periods (..)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with two consecutive full-width periods (..), which is not standard in Japanese and can distract readers. Only one full-width period should be used.

examples.wrong: 三角形の種類について学んでいるところなので、正三角形という名前が指しているのは、その特徴である3つの等しい辺についてのことです..
examples.correct: 三角形の種類について学んでいるところなので、正三角形という名前が指しているのは、その特徴である3つの等しい辺についてのことです。

examples.wrong: 固定マインドセットは、自分の能力が固定されていると考え、挑戦や障害に直面することを避けがちです。この認識は、個人が新しいスキルを学び、成長する機会を見過ごす可能性があります..
examples.correct: 固定マインドセットは、自分の能力が固定されていると考え、挑戦や障害に直面することを避けがちです。この認識は、個人が新しいスキルを学び、成長する機会を見過ごす可能性があります。

examples.wrong: ニュートンの万有引力の法則は、物体間の距離が変わると引力が変動することを考慮しています。地球から離れるために必要な速度は、距離が着実に減少するにつれて確実に減少します..
examples.correct: ニュートンの万有引力の法則は、物体間の距離が変わると引力が変動することを考慮しています。地球から離れるために必要な速度は、距離が着実に減少するにつれて確実に減少します。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnecessary comma (、) after topic marker or at start of sentence
top_error_patterns.description: Commas (、) are placed after the topic marker 'は' or at the start of sentences, which is unnecessary in Japanese and disrupts the natural flow. This is a minor orthographic issue.

examples.wrong: 人権は、すべての人に平等に与えられる基本的な権利です。
examples.correct: 人権はすべての人に平等に与えられる基本的な権利です。

examples.wrong: 例えば、エレノア・ルーズベルトは、世界人権宣言を「すべての人々と国々のための共通の達成基準」と表現しました。
examples.correct: 例えばエレノア・ルーズベルトは世界人権宣言を「すべての人々と国々のための共通の達成基準」と表現しました。

examples.wrong: 世界人権宣言は、戦争の恐怖や抑圧が再び起こることを防ぐために作成されました。
examples.correct: 世界人権宣言は戦争の恐怖や抑圧が再び起こることを防ぐために作成されました。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Emoji or informal symbol at end of educational sentence
top_error_patterns.description: Use of emoji (e.g., 🌱) at the end of formal educational content is not standard and can affect the professional tone. Emojis should be avoided unless pedagogically justified.

examples.wrong: 生命の基本を理解するための重要なステップです！ 🌱
examples.correct: 生命の基本を理解するための重要なステップです！

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inappropriate Use of Emojis in Formal Contexts
top_error_patterns.description: Emojis such as '🌏' are used in educational content, which can undermine the professional tone expected in formal Japanese materials.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnatural Loanword Usage for Educational Terminology
top_error_patterns.description: Loanwords like 'メカニズム' are used where more natural Japanese terms such as '仕組み' would improve clarity and fit for educational content.

examples.wrong: 記憶の保存を強化するメカニズムです。
examples.correct: 記憶の定着を強化する仕組みです。
examples.context: Explanations of scientific or educational concepts

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that do not exist in Polish or are incorrect for the context, leading to confusion and misrepresentation of facts.

examples.correct: świątynie
Stanach Zjednoczonych
prelekcje

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect case, gender, or number agreement
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent errors in noun/adjective case, gender, or number agreement, which disrupt grammatical correctness and clarity.

examples.correct: W starożytnym Egipcie

examples.wrong: Hieroglify, znany również jako hieroglify, był systemem pisma
examples.correct: Hieroglify, znane również jako hieroglify, były systemem pisma
procesami wewnętrznymi

top_error_patterns.description: Misspelled words or non-standard forms that hinder comprehension and reduce professionalism.

examples.correct: ponieważ
Jeśli wątpisz
zazwyczaj

top_error_patterns.description: Use of grammatically incorrect or awkward phrases that obscure meaning and reduce clarity.

examples.correct: podejmować decyzje

examples.wrong: umiejętności rozumieć i stawiać wartość na argumenty
examples.correct: umiejętności rozumienia i oceniania wartości argumentów
zdanie o relacji

top_error_patterns.description: Use of incorrect or non-standard technical terms, especially in scientific or educational contexts, leading to misinformation.

examples.correct: liczby zmiennoprzecinkowe
lizosomy
'elektrowniami komórki'

top_error_patterns.description: Use of confusing or contextually inappropriate references that do not fit the educational or cultural context, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Jaśne morze, jak przypomina miasto Jastrzębie-Zdroje, znane z żywiołów morskich, odgrywa znaczną rolę w regulacji klimatu.
examples.correct: Morza i oceany odgrywają znaczącą rolę w regulacji klimatu.
examples.context: Feedback for climate zone question uses irrelevant city and sea references.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Use of untranslated English technical terms
top_error_patterns.description: Retention of English technical terms instead of using standard Polish equivalents, which can hinder comprehension and reduce professionalism in educational content.

examples.correct: wywołania systemowe
examples.context: Technical explanation in quiz uses English term instead of Polish.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent mistakes in gender, number, and case agreement between nouns, adjectives, and verbs, leading to unnatural or incorrect sentences.

examples.correct: funkcję komórkową
examples.context: Incorrect noun case and number agreement.

examples.correct: miałyby trudności
examples.context: Subject-verb agreement error with plural noun.

examples.correct: głównej formy energii

examples.wrong: co skutkowałoby błędne działanie lub błąd kompilacji.
examples.correct: co skutkowałoby błędnym działaniem lub błędem kompilacji.
Ostateczny rodzaj przechowywanej informacji
z ciastem

top_error_patterns.description: Use of unnatural, incorrect, or non-idiomatic words and phrases that reduce clarity and sound unnatural to native speakers.

examples.correct: aby zachować równowagę równania
examples.context: Unnatural phrase for maintaining equation balance.

examples.wrong: Rozwiązywanie konfliktów nie chodzi o zniechęcanie stron do nieustanowania sporu.
examples.correct: Rozwiązywanie konfliktów nie polega na zniechęcaniu stron do kontynuowania sporu.
examples.context: Non-idiomatic construction and incorrect word choice.

examples.wrong: Empatia polega tylko na poczynianiu zobowiązań w stosunku do innych.
examples.correct: Empatia nie polega tylko na składaniu zobowiązań wobec innych.

examples.wrong: To zwiększało efektywność przekazywania informacji w zakresie, który wymagał dokładnego przekazywania wierzeń i przeznaczeń.
examples.correct: To zwiększało efektywność przekazywania informacji w zakresie, który wymagał dokładnego przekazywania wierzeń i tradycji.
widoczne
examples.context: Lexical error for describing something visible.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of colloquial abbreviations or spelling mistakes that undermine the professional tone required in educational content.

examples.correct: szacunek
examples.context: Colloquial abbreviation inappropriate for formal context.

examples.wrong: Ta faktualność opiera się na podstawowej wiedzy w kodowaniu...
examples.correct: Ta prawidłowość opiera się na podstawowej wiedzy w kodowaniu...
examples.context: Calque from English; unnatural word in Polish.

top_error_patterns.description: Problems with sentence structure, missing punctuation, or incorrect prepositions that affect clarity and grammatical correctness.

examples.wrong: Dowód, że 'Ten krem przeciwsłoneczny jest bezpieczny, ponieważ jest na rynku przez wiele lat.
examples.correct: Dowód, że 'Ten krem przeciwsłoneczny jest bezpieczny', ponieważ jest na rynku od wielu lat.
examples.context: Missing quotation mark and incorrect preposition.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of terms that do not fit the cultural or historical context, leading to misrepresentation or confusion for Polish audiences.

examples.correct: złote ozdoby
examples.context: Ancient Egyptian artifacts; 'złote kule' is not culturally accurate, while 'złote ozdoby' reflects actual historical items.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of awkward or non-standard phrasing in mathematical contexts, reducing clarity and naturalness for Polish learners.

examples.correct: je spełniają
examples.context: Describing solutions to equations; the corrected phrase is idiomatic and widely understood in Polish mathematics education.

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect grammatical agreement between adjectives and nouns, affecting linguistic accuracy and professional tone.

examples.correct: bardziej zróżnicowane i wszechstronne programowanie
examples.context: Describing programming; adjectives must match the neuter singular noun 'programowanie'.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that are not idiomatic or precise in Polish, affecting naturalness and clarity.

examples.correct: wspiera ich rozwój osobisty
examples.context: More natural and idiomatic phrasing for personal development.

examples.correct: pomaga w rozwiązywaniu konfliktów
examples.context: Aspect and context require the gerund form.

examples.correct: składanie zobowiązań

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect case or form of adjectives and nouns
top_error_patterns.description: Adjectives or nouns are used in the wrong grammatical case or form, leading to minor clarity or correctness issues.

examples.correct: Ta propozycja jest poprawna
examples.context: Adjective in instrumental case instead of nominative to match the subject.

examples.correct: bez wyrażania uczuć
examples.context: Gerund form needed for standard usage after 'bez'.

top_error_patterns.description: Technical terms are used imprecisely, which may cause minor confusion in specialized contexts.

examples.correct: instrukcji programistycznych

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that do not exist in Russian or are inappropriate for the context, leading to confusion and loss of meaning.

examples.correct: водоснабжение
examples.context: Quiz item about water supply; 'водоедло' is not a Russian word.

examples.correct: норы
examples.context: Describing kangaroo rat burrows; 'толпады' is not a valid term.

examples.correct: мастерам
examples.context: Comparing organelles to workers; 'дележкам' is not appropriate.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Spelling Errors and Nonstandard Word Forms
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent misspellings and use of nonstandard forms, including mixing Latin and Cyrillic letters, which disrupts comprehension and professionalism.

examples.correct: разработаны
обрабатывать
examples.context: Mixing Latin and Cyrillic letters in a verb.

examples.correct: непрерывный

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Grammatical Errors in Case, Agreement, and Verb Forms
top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in noun case, verb conjugation, and agreement, which reduce clarity and can misrepresent facts.

examples.correct: закона о гражданских правах
examples.context: Incorrect noun case in legal context.

examples.correct: присоединился только один человек
для большей силы
examples.context: Incorrect case and agreement in comparative phrase.

top_error_patterns.description: Misuse of scientific terms or confusion between related concepts, leading to factual inaccuracies and misleading educational content.

examples.wrong: алгебраические выражения представляют собой математические уравнения
examples.correct: алгебраические выражения представляют собой математические выражения
кристы
океанические течения

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Code-Mixing and Use of English Letters in Russian Words
top_error_patterns.description: Insertion of English letters or code-mixed words in Russian text, which undermines professionalism and can confuse learners.

examples.correct: органеллы
examples.context: Feedback section uses mixed English and Russian letters.

examples.correct: обрабатывать

top_error_patterns.description: Misuse of terms that do not fit the historical or cultural context, leading to confusion or misrepresentation of facts.

examples.wrong: Средневековые торговцы использовали реку Нил как основной маршрут для обмена продукцией и товарами.
examples.correct: Древнеегипетские торговцы использовали реку Нил как основной маршрут для обмена продукцией и товарами.
examples.context: Reference to traders in Ancient Egypt incorrectly labeled as 'medieval', causing a mismatch in historical context.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of terms or phrases that are not standard, precise, or idiomatic in Russian, affecting scientific accuracy and comprehension.

examples.correct: основу для структуры
Амазонские дождевые леса
examples.context: Standard term for 'Amazon rainforest' in Russian.

examples.correct: белые медведи и пингвины
examples.context: General term 'медведи' is imprecise for polar regions.

examples.correct: температуру воздуха и влажность

top_error_patterns.description: Use of literal translations or incorrect terms that do not match standard Russian usage, especially in educational, scientific, or technical contexts.

examples.correct: митохондрии или другие органеллы
examples.context: Scientific terminology; 'митохондры' is non-standard, and 'яйцеклетки' is not an organelle.

examples.correct: для каждого студента из 5:
examples.context: Programming pseudocode; literal translation from English, not idiomatic in Russian.

examples.correct: Используйте «Я»-высказывания:
examples.context: Educational/psychological terminology; 'утверждения' is a literal translation, not standard in Russian literature.

examples.correct: сельскохозяйственных работников
examples.context: General terminology; 'товарищей' is unnatural, 'работников' is precise and culturally appropriate.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect use of grammatical cases and prepositions
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent mistakes in case usage and preposition selection, leading to unnatural or incorrect phrasing and reduced clarity.

examples.correct: со средой обитания
examples.context: Preposition 'с' should be 'со' before consonant clusters and requires instrumental case.

examples.correct: обеспечение энергией для роста
могут храниться в переменной
examples.context: Incorrect passive construction; reflexive verb is standard.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Agreement errors in participles and collective nouns
top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in grammatical agreement between participles and nouns, or misuse of collective nouns, leading to awkward or incorrect sentences.

examples.correct: способствующим фотосинтезу
examples.context: Participle should agree with singular noun.

examples.correct: в группах, чтобы охотиться

top_error_patterns.description: Use of informal language or personalized references (e.g., 'вашем саду') in educational content reduces neutrality and may not suit all audiences.

examples.wrong: Например, подсолнух в вашем саду питается энергией, полученной хлоропластами.
examples.correct: Например, подсолнух в саду получает энергию благодаря хлоропластам.
Добро пожаловать в мир алгебры!
examples.context: Introductory statements using emojis or informal tone

top_error_patterns.description: Use of less common collocations or omission of standard abbreviations reduces clarity and professionalism in educational Russian.

examples.wrong: Поздравляем! Вы сделали первый шаг в изучении алгебры. Продолжайте практиковаться, чтобы укрепить свои знания!
examples.correct: Поздравляем! Вы сделали первый шаг в изучении алгебры. Продолжайте практиковаться, чтобы закрепить свои знания!
эндоплазматическому ретикулуму (ЭПР)

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect use of prepositions in scientific contexts
top_error_patterns.description: Non-idiomatic or incorrect prepositions are used when describing scientific processes, leading to awkward or unclear phrasing.

examples.wrong: Адаптации происходят постепенно через процесс естественного отбора.
examples.correct: Адаптации происходят постепенно в процессе естественного отбора.
examples.context: Describing gradual processes in scientific explanations.

top_error_patterns.description: Adjectives or participles do not agree in gender or case with the nouns they modify, reducing grammatical correctness and clarity.

examples.wrong: необходимым для различных процессов роста и размножения у растений
examples.correct: необходимой для различных процессов роста и размножения у растений
examples.context: Describing properties of substances in scientific contexts.

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in noun-adjective agreement or case usage that reduce clarity and professionalism.

examples.correct: прочные связи
examples.context: Phrase in a sentence; adjective does not agree with noun in gender and number.

top_error_patterns.description: Variables in mathematical expressions are formatted with backticks, which is not standard in Russian educational materials and may confuse learners.

examples.correct: вы купили ещё x яблок

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inconsistent use of 'ё' vs 'е' in formal writing
top_error_patterns.description: The letter 'ё' is sometimes replaced with 'е', which can cause ambiguity. Consistent use of 'ё' is important for educational clarity.

examples.wrong: Нерешенные конфликты могут вызывать стресс и негативные эмоции.
examples.correct: Нерешённые конфликты могут вызывать стресс и негативные эмоции.
examples.context: Spelling in educational and formal contexts.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of bold or other formatting for single words (e.g., 'нет') is distracting and not standard in Russian educational texts.

examples.correct: В выражениях нет знака равенства.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of less precise grammatical forms (e.g., 'куда' instead of 'в которую') in analogies can reduce clarity and naturalness.

examples.wrong: Это как коробка, куда можно положить данные, чтобы использовать их позже.
examples.correct: Это как коробка, в которую можно положить данные, чтобы использовать их позже.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Gender Agreement Errors with Articles and Nouns
top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect use of definite articles that do not match the grammatical gender of the noun, leading to confusion and reduced clarity.

examples.correct: La clorofila
examples.context: Mismatch between masculine article and feminine noun.

examples.correct: los sentimientos
examples.context: Mismatch between feminine article and masculine plural noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of incorrect or non-standard terms for well-known concepts or references, resulting in misrepresentation and loss of meaning.

examples.correct: Sueño de libertad
examples.context: Mislabeling of Martin Luther King Jr.'s famous speech, causing confusion about the historical reference.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inappropriate Use of Emojis in Educational Content
top_error_patterns.description: Emojis such as 🌍, ✨, and 🌟 are used in educational materials, which may be perceived as informal or unprofessional in Spanish-speaking academic contexts. Removing them maintains a suitable tone for formal learning environments.

examples.wrong: Descubriremos las increíbles adaptaciones físicas y comportamentales que permiten a los animales prosperar en diferentes ecosistemas del mundo. 🌍✨
examples.correct: Descubriremos las increíbles adaptaciones físicas y comportamentales que permiten a los animales prosperar en diferentes ecosistemas del mundo.

examples.wrong: ¡Prepárense para explorar las zonas climáticas de la Tierra y aprender cómo afectan la vida en nuestro planeta! 🌍
examples.correct: ¡Prepárate para explorar las zonas climáticas de la Tierra y aprender cómo afectan la vida en nuestro planeta!

examples.wrong: Prepárate para aprender habilidades esenciales que te serán útiles en todos los aspectos de tu vida. 🌟
examples.correct: Prepárate para aprender habilidades esenciales que te serán útiles en todos los aspectos de tu vida.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of terms or phrasing that are technically correct but unnatural or imprecise in Spanish, reducing clarity and localization fit.

examples.correct: Necesitas 1 huevo y medio.

examples.wrong: En el lenguaje de programación, los enteros son capaces de almacenar números sin signo, lo que incluye valores positivos y negativos.
examples.correct: En el lenguaje de programación, los enteros son capaces de almacenar números con o sin signo, lo que incluye valores positivos y negativos.

examples.wrong: El legado de la ingeniosidad egipcia en la ingeniería es evidente en monumentos como las pirámides y el Sphinx.
examples.correct: El legado de la ingeniosidad egipcia en la ingeniería es evidente en monumentos como las pirámides y la Esfinge.

top_error_patterns.description: Direct translations or calques from English (e.g., 'para consistencia', 'lenguaje secreto') result in unnatural phrasing in Spanish. Corrections use more idiomatic and inclusive language, improving clarity and cultural fit.

examples.correct: Usar letras minúsculas para mantener la consistencia.

examples.wrong: El álgebra es como un lenguaje secreto que usamos para expresar relaciones y resolver problemas utilizando números y símbolos.
examples.correct: El álgebra es como un lenguaje especial que usamos para expresar relaciones y resolver problemas utilizando números y símbolos.

examples.wrong: Imagina que quieres encontrar el número más grande en una lista de números:
examples.correct: Imagina que quieres encontrar el número mayor en una lista de números:

top_error_patterns.description: Technical terms are sometimes capitalized incorrectly or used redundantly. Corrections ensure terms like 'verdadero o falso' are not capitalized mid-sentence and avoid unnecessary repetition (e.g., 'creíble y confiable').

examples.correct: Booleano: verdadero o falso.

examples.wrong: Fiabilidad: ¿Es la fuente creíble y confiable?
examples.correct: Fiabilidad: ¿Es la fuente confiable?
desierto australiano

top_error_patterns.description: Mixing present and past tenses within the same sentence or context, leading to confusion and reduced clarity.

examples.wrong: Proporcionando recursos esenciales como agua y nutrientes, permitió la agricultura, que sustenta el crecimiento de una civilización.
examples.correct: Proporcionando recursos esenciales como agua y nutrientes, permitió la agricultura, que sustentó el crecimiento de una civilización.

examples.wrong: Las zonas climáticas continentales tienen temperaturas extremadamente altas durante el verano.
examples.correct: Las zonas climáticas continentales pueden tener temperaturas altas durante el verano, pero no necesariamente extremas.
examples.context: Describing climate characteristics in educational content.

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect use of gendered articles and missing definite articles, which affects grammatical correctness and clarity.

examples.wrong: para la camuflaje en su ambiente helado y para mantener calor.
examples.correct: para el camuflaje en su ambiente helado y para mantener el calor.
pensamiento de grupo
examples.context: Critical thinking terminology in quiz questions.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of the dollar sign ($) instead of the culturally appropriate euro (€) or local currency symbol in Spanish educational content, which can cause confusion and reduce localization quality.

examples.wrong: Si tienes $20 y quieres comprar cuadernos que cuestan $4 cada uno...
examples.correct: Si tienes 20 € y quieres comprar cuadernos que cuestan 4 € cada uno...
examples.context: Currency references in math or shopping scenarios

top_error_patterns.description: Use of literal or uncommon translations for official names of laws or acts, rather than the standard terminology recognized in Spanish-speaking contexts, which can hinder comprehension and consistency.

examples.correct: Ley de Derecho al Voto de 1965
examples.context: References to historical or legal acts in educational content

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Format and Syntax Adaptation for Spanish Contexts
top_error_patterns.description: Formatting conventions such as LaTeX delimiters or pseudocode syntax may not be familiar or accessible to all Spanish-speaking learners. Corrections present equations and code in plain text or with Spanish keywords.

examples.wrong: En la ecuación \( x + 5 = 10 \), \( x \) es la variable.
examples.correct: En la ecuación x + 5 = 10, x es la variable.

examples.wrong:
PARA número = 1 HASTA 10
    IMPRIMIR número
FIN PARA
examples.correct:
PARA número = 1 HASTA 10
    IMPRIMIR número
FIN PARA

top_error_patterns.description: English-style double quotes are used instead of Spanish angle quotation marks (« ») for highlighting terms or concepts.

examples.wrong: Comienza con el primer número como el "mayor".
examples.correct: Comienza con el primer número como el «mayor».
examples.context: Highlighting terms or concepts in instructions.

top_error_patterns.description: Titles or headings capitalize more than the first word, which is not standard in Spanish unless proper nouns are involved.

examples.correct: ¿Qué son los bucles simples?

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing definite articles in noun phrases
top_error_patterns.description: Definite articles are omitted in complex noun phrases, reducing clarity and naturalness in Spanish.

examples.wrong: Esto demuestra su avanzado conocimiento en organización de trabajo y planificación logística.
examples.correct: Esto demuestra su avanzado conocimiento en la organización del trabajo y la planificación logística.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect verb conjugation in general statements
top_error_patterns.description: Subjunctive is used instead of indicative when expressing general facts, leading to grammatical inaccuracy.

examples.wrong: La idea de que las variables no puedan almacenar información es incorrecta...
examples.correct: La idea de que las variables no pueden almacenar información es incorrecta...

top_error_patterns.description: Phrases like 'Ejemplo en código' are used instead of the idiomatic 'Ejemplo de código' to introduce code examples.

examples.correct: Ejemplo de código:
examples.context: Introducing code samples in educational content.

top_error_patterns.description: Explanations sometimes overgeneralize or misrepresent practical realities (e.g., algebra in cooking). Corrections clarify cultural and practical limitations, making content more relevant and accurate for Spanish-speaking learners.

examples.wrong: En la cocina, las medidas suelen ser de tamaño entero, y el álgebra podría ser útil para planificar cantidades de ingredientes para un número diferente de servicios, no para ajustar fracciones exactas de una receta.
examples.correct: En la práctica culinaria las medidas suelen ser enteras y no siempre es posible usar fracciones exactas de ingredientes como huevos.
